cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles E of Andros Island, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the northwestern Bahamas, forecast to parallel the Florida east coast, then curve north-northwest and accelerate up the U.S. East Coast toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast of South-North Carolina border area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to south of Boca Raton FL; Volusia/Flagler County Line to Ponte Vedra Beach FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Boca Raton to the Volusia/Flagler County Line FL; Northwestern Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through New England, including Chesapeake Bay region
weather_observation.wind: Low (4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusts to 35–45 mph possible late Tue–early Wed if core passes inland of bay
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor 1–2 ft surge possible in upper Chesapeake Bay with on-shore winds during Tue–Wed high-tide cycles
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated higher totals could cause brief flash flooding and reduced visibility during Tue–Wed
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along nearby Atlantic beaches, minor coastal flooding, and logistical delays to vessel traffic in Chesapeake approaches
